alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 9:54PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: .Heavy rainfall has caused flooding in the Fargo Moorhead metro areas. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Minnesota and southeast North Dakota, including the following counties, in west central Minnesota, Clay. In southeast North Dakota, Cass. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fargo, Moorhead, West Fargo, Dilworth, Reile`s Acres, Oakport, Frontier, Prairie Rose, Briarwood and North River.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
